questions.text: What is a volcano?
questions.articleBody: A volcano is a mountain that opens downward to a pool of molten rock below the surface of the earth. When pressure builds up, eruptions occur. Eruptions can cause lateral blasts, lava flows, hot ash flows, mudslides, avalanches, falling ash and floods.

questions.text: What builds up to cause an eruption?
questions.articleBody: A volcano is a mountain that opens downward to a pool of molten rock below the surface of the earth. When pressure builds up, eruptions occur. Eruptions can cause lateral blasts, lava flows, hot ash flows, mudslides, avalanches, falling ash and floods.

questions.text: Sharks have a skeleton made of...
questions.articleBody: Sharks are fascinating creatures. Unlike most fish, sharks do not have bones. Their skeleton is made of cartilage, which is the same flexible material that your ears and nose are made of! Sharks also have multiple rows of teeth. When they lose a tooth, a new one spins forward to replace it.

questions.text: What happens when a shark loses a tooth?

questions.explanation: Compare the value of Group A (hundreds) to Group B (tens). Consider how many times you would need to multiply 20 to get 200, or think about the place value shift from the tens place to the hundreds place.
options: Group A is 100 times the value of Group B.
Group B is 10 times the value of Group A.
Group A is 10 times the value of Group B.
Group B is 1/100 the value of Group A.
questions.text: Look at the base-ten blocks in the image. Group A represents 200. Group B represents 20. Which statement is true?
questions.reportingCategory: Number Sense and Operations with Whole Numbers

questions.explanation: Analyze the relationship between 800 and 80. Since 80 is smaller than 800 by exactly one place value, look for the equation that shows division by 10 to reduce the value.
questions.text: Which equation correctly represents the relationship between the value of the digit 8 in 800 and the digit 8 in 80?
questions.reportingCategory: Number Sense and Operations with Whole Numbers

questions.articleBody: Liam found an old, dusty map tucked inside a library book about pirates. The edges were burnt, and it smelled like salt water. A red X marked a spot near the old lighthouse on the cliff. Liam decided to call his best friend, Maya, to help him investigate. They grabbed flashlights and a shovel, hoping to find gold.
questions.text: Where did Liam find the map?

questions.articleBody: In the year 2050, humans built the first colony on Mars called 'Ares Base.' Dr. Aris Thorne was the head botanist, and his job was to grow food in the red Martian soil. It was difficult because Mars is freezing cold and has very thin air. To keep the plants alive, they lived inside a giant glass dome. One morning, a red alarm flashed in Greenhouse 3. The heating system had broken! Aris grabbed his toolbox and sprinted through the airlock. He knew he had only twenty minutes to fix the heater before the frost destroyed the colony's first crop of tomatoes. With shaking hands, he reconnected the power wire just in time. That night, the whole crew celebrated by eating a fresh salad, the first meal ever grown on another planet.
questions.text: What year does the story take place?
